DOC.brief_summary: Acute myocardial infarction characterize intense inflammatory response . The degree response influence clinical outcome , 'more ' inflammation promote heart failure . In study plan determine whether treatment plasma derive alpha-1 antitrypsin quench inflammatory response patient acute ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction ( STEMI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Alpha-1 Anti-Trypsin ( AAT ) Treatment Acute Myocardial Infarction
DOC.criteria: Acute STEMI define chest pain ( equivalent ) onset within 12 hour ECG evidence ST segment elevation ( > 1 mm ) 2 anatomically contiguous lead new presumably new Planned complete coronary angiogram potential intervention Age > 21 Inability give inform consent Hemodynamic instability define need inotropic vasoactive agent , need mechanical support device ( include intraaortic balloon pump ) Pregnancy Preexisting congestive heart failure ( American Heart Association/American College Cardiology class CD , New York Heart Association IIIIV ) Preexisting severe leave ventricular dysfunction ( EF < 20 % ) Preexisting severe valvular heart disease Known active infection ( acute chronic ) Recent ( < 14 day ) active use antiinflammatory drug ( include NSAIDs corticosteroid use IV dye allergy ) Known chronic inflammatory disease ( include limit rheumatoid arthritis , systemic lupus erythematosus ) Known active malignancy type , prior diagnosis past 10 year Anticipated need cardiac major surgery Known active cancer ( prior diagnosis cancer within past 10 year ) Known Immunoglobulin A ( IgA ) deficiency
